content:
What you're describing is often correct. 

When I use language like "You can't think about yourself" it's the same as when J.K. says "the observer is the observed". 

It's a bit like "ok here's the K.O. move, did it work???? Ok no it didn't, hmmmm, fuck...."

It's a bit like saying "here is the question, here is the conclusion, do you see the logical or procedural inquiry that must be done in-between to resolve them?" "If yes, you must then do the inquiry".

Most of what I'm communicating is trying to say "this is the results" or "this is the question that starts it" or "this is the conclusion", but the problem is the middle part of "solve it for me" is always up to the invidual to engage because it is literally resolving the individuals confusion about their own existence and experience of life.
